docs.title: NMM-PS Documentation
docs.text:
Welcome to the NMM-PS documentation - a PowerShell module for automating Nerdio Manager for MSP (NMM) operations.

  • Quick Install

    Install NMM-PS from PowerShell Gallery:

    Install-Module -Name NMM-PS

    Installation Guide

  • Authentication

    Connect using client secret or certificate:

    Connect-NMMApi

    Authentication Guide

  • Cmdlet Reference

    Browse all 60+ cmdlets organized by category

    Cmdlet Reference

  • Open Source

    Contribute on GitHub - issues, PRs welcome

    GitHub Repository

docs.title: Features
docs.text:
• 60+ Cmdlets covering accounts, host pools, session hosts, images, users, devices, and more
  • Multiple Authentication Methods - Client secret or certificate-based authentication
  • Pipeline Support - Chain cmdlets together for powerful automation
  • Cross-Platform - Works on Windows, macOS, and Linux with PowerShell 7+
  • Auto-Pagination - Handles large result sets automatically

docs.title: Quick Start
docs.text:
# Install the module
Install-Module -Name NMM-PS

# Import the module
Import-Module NMM-PS

# Connect to NMM API
Connect-NMMApi

# List all accounts
Get-NMMAccount

# Get host pools for a specific account
Get-NMMAccount -AccountId 12345 | Get-NMMHostPool

docs.title: API Coverage
docs.text:
NMM-PS covers the following NMM API areas:

Category Cmdlets API Version Accounts Get-NMMAccount v1 Host Pools Get-NMMHostPool, Get-NMMHostPoolSettings, + 10 more v1 Session Hosts Get-NMMHost, Get-NMMHostSchedule v1 Desktop Images Get-NMMDesktopImage, Get-NMMImageTemplate, + 3 more v1 Users & Groups Get-NMMUser, Get-NMMUsers, Get-NMMGroup v1 Devices Get-NMMDevice, Sync-NMMDevice, + 6 more v1-beta Backup Get-NMMBackup, Get-NMMProtectedItem, Get-NMMRecoveryPoint v1 Automation Get-NMMScriptedAction, Get-NMMSchedule, + 3 more v1

docs.title: Requirements
docs.text:
• PowerShell 7.0+ (PowerShell Core)
  • NMM API Access - Valid API credentials from Nerdio Manager

docs.title: Getting Help
docs.text:
• Documentation: You're here!
  • GitHub Issues: Report bugs or request features
  • PowerShell Help: Get-Help Connect-NMMApi -Full

docs.title: SYNOPSIS
docs.text: Retrieves all accounts in the NMM portal.

docs.title: SYNTAX
docs.text:
Get-Accounts [[-id] <Int32[]>] [[-Name] <String[]>] [[-TenantId] <String[]>]
 [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

docs.title: DESCRIPTION
docs.text: This function retrieves all accounts in the NMM portal.

docs.title: Example 1
docs.text:
PS C:\> {{ Get-Accounts }}

{{ Retrieves all accounts in the NMM portal.}}

docs.title: Example 2
docs.text:
PS C:\> {{ Get-Accounts -id 2 }}

{{ Retrieves the account with the specified id.}}

docs.title: Example 3
docs.text:
PS C:\> {{ Get-Accounts -id 2 -Name "Airplane" }}

{{ Retrieves the accounts with the specified id and name, it will use Regex and match the name. This expample will retrun all accounts with the name "Airplane" in it and all accounts that match -id 2.}}

docs.title: Changelog
docs.text:
All notable changes to NMM-PS will be documented in this file.

The format is based on Keep a Changelog, and this project adheres to Semantic Versioning.

docs.title: Added
docs.text:
• Certificate-based authentication support
  • New-NMMApiCertificate cmdlet for creating self-signed certificates
  • Certificate thumbprint and PFX file authentication in Connect-NMMApi
  • Cross-platform support (Windows and macOS)
  • MkDocs documentation site with Nerdio branding
  • 60+ cmdlets for NMM API operations

docs.title: Changed
docs.text: • Renamed Upload-CertificateToAzureAD to Publish-CertificateToAzureAD for PowerShell verb compliance

docs.title: Fixed
docs.text:
• Cross-platform certificate handling on macOS/.NET Core
  • RSA private key extraction compatibility across platforms

docs.title: Added
docs.text:
• Core authentication with Connect-NMMApi
  • Account management cmdlets
  • Host pool management cmdlets
  • Session host cmdlets
  • Desktop image cmdlets
  • User and group cmdlets
  • Device management cmdlets (Beta API)
  • Backup cmdlets
  • Automation and scheduling cmdlets
  • Pipeline support for chained operations
  • Partner Center bulk enrollment support

docs.title: Version History Summary
docs.text: Version Date Highlights Unreleased - Certificate auth, documentation site 1.0.0 - Initial release with 60+ cmdlets

docs.title: Cmdlet Reference
docs.text: NMM-PS provides 60+ cmdlets organized by functional area.

docs.title: Authentication
docs.text:
Connect to the NMM API and manage credentials.

Cmdlet Description Connect-NMMApi Authenticate to the NMM API Get-NMMApiToken Get the current cached token New-NMMApiCertificate Create certificate for auth

docs.title: Accounts
docs.text:
Manage NMM accounts.

Cmdlet Description Get-NMMAccount List or get NMM accounts

docs.title: Host Pools
docs.text:
Manage Azure Virtual Desktop host pools.

Cmdlet Description Get-NMMHostPool List host pools Get-NMMHostPoolSettings Get AVD settings Get-NMMHostPoolAutoscale Get autoscale config Get-NMMHostPoolAD Get AD settings Get-NMMHostPoolRDP Get RDP settings Get-NMMHostPoolFSLogix Get FSLogix config Get-NMMHostPoolSchedule Get scheduled jobs Get-NMMHostPoolUser Get assigned users Get-NMMHostPoolSession Get active sessions

docs.title: Session Hosts
docs.text:
Manage individual session hosts within pools.

Cmdlet Description Get-NMMHost List session hosts Get-NMMHostSchedule Get host schedules

docs.title: Desktop Images
docs.text:
Manage golden images and templates.

Cmdlet Description Get-NMMDesktopImage List desktop images Get-NMMDesktopImageDetail Get image details Get-NMMImageTemplate List image templates

docs.title: Users & Groups
docs.text:
Manage users and groups.

Cmdlet Description Get-NMMUser Get user details Get-NMMUsers Search/list users Get-NMMGroup Get group details

docs.title: Devices (Beta API)
docs.text:
Manage Intune-enrolled devices.

Cmdlet Description Note Get-NMMDevice List devices Beta Get-NMMDeviceCompliance Get compliance status Beta Sync-NMMDevice Force Intune sync Beta

Beta API

Device cmdlets use the v1-beta API and may change without notice.

docs.title: Backup
docs.text:
Manage Azure Backup protected items.

Cmdlet Description Get-NMMBackup List backup items Get-NMMProtectedItem Get protected items Get-NMMRecoveryPoint List recovery points

docs.title: Automation
docs.text:
Manage scripted actions and schedules.

Cmdlet Description Get-NMMScriptedAction List scripted actions Get-NMMSchedule List schedules Get-NMMAutoscaleProfile Get autoscale profiles

docs.title: Pipeline Support
docs.text:
Most NMM-PS cmdlets support pipeline input for chaining:

# Get all host pools for all accounts
Get-NMMAccount | Get-NMMHostPool

# Get sessions for specific accounts
Get-NMMAccount -Name "Contoso*" | Get-NMMHostPool | Get-NMMHostPoolSession

docs.title: Common Parameters
docs.text:
All cmdlets support:

  • -Verbose - Show detailed progress
  • -Debug - Show debug information
  • -ErrorAction - Control error behavior

docs.title: Getting Help
docs.text:
Use PowerShell's built-in help:

# Get help for a cmdlet
Get-Help Get-NMMHostPool -Full

# List all parameters
Get-Help Connect-NMMApi -Parameter *

# Show examples
Get-Help Get-NMMAccount -Examples

docs.title: Account Cmdlets
docs.text:
Cmdlets for managing NMM accounts.

Cmdlet Description Get-NMMAccount List or retrieve NMM accounts

docs.title: Get-NMMAccount
docs.text: Lists or retrieves NMM accounts.

docs.title: Syntax
docs.text:
Get-NMMAccount
    [-AccountId <Int32>]
    [-Name <String>]
    [<CommonParameters>]

docs.title: Description
docs.text: The Get-NMMAccount cmdlet retrieves NMM accounts. Without parameters, it returns all accounts. Use -AccountId to get a specific account or -Name to filter by name pattern.

docs.title: -AccountId
docs.text:
The ID of a specific account to retrieve.

Type Int32 Required False Aliases id

docs.title: -Name
docs.text:
Filter accounts by name (supports wildcards).

Type String Required False

docs.title: Example 1: Get all accounts
docs.text:
Get-NMMAccount

Returns all NMM accounts.

docs.title: Example 2: Get specific account by ID
docs.text: Get-NMMAccount -AccountId 123

docs.title: Example 3: Filter by name
docs.text:
Get-NMMAccount -Name "Contoso*"

Returns accounts with names starting with "Contoso".

docs.title: Outputs
docs.text:
PSCustomObject[]

Property Type Description id Int32 Account ID name String Account name tenantId String Azure AD tenant ID subscriptionId String Azure subscription ID

docs.title: Notes
docs.text:
• This cmdlet is typically the starting point for pipeline operations
  • Account IDs are required for most other cmdlets

docs.title: Related Links
docs.text: • Get-NMMHostPool

docs.title: Authentication Cmdlets
docs.text:
Cmdlets for connecting to and authenticating with the NMM API.

Cmdlet Description Connect-NMMApi Authenticate to the NMM API Get-NMMApiToken Get the current cached access token New-NMMApiCertificate Create a certificate for authentication

docs.title: Connect-NMMApi
docs.text: Authenticates to the NMM API and caches the access token.

docs.title: Syntax
docs.text:
Connect-NMMApi
    [-BaseURI <String>]
    [-TenantId <String>]
    [-ClientId <String>]
    [-ClientSecret <String>]
    [-Scope <String>]
    [<CommonParameters>]

Connect-NMMApi
    -CertificateThumbprint <String>
    [-BaseURI <String>]
    [-TenantId <String>]
    [-ClientId <String>]
    [-Scope <String>]
    [<CommonParameters>]

Connect-NMMApi
    -CertificatePath <String>
    [-CertificatePassword <SecureString>]
    [-BaseURI <String>]
    [-TenantId <String>]
    [-ClientId <String>]
    [-Scope <String>]
    [<CommonParameters>]

docs.title: Description
docs.text: The Connect-NMMApi cmdlet authenticates to the NMM API using either client secret or certificate-based authentication. Upon successful authentication, the access token is cached for subsequent API calls.

docs.title: -BaseURI
docs.text:
The NMM API base URL.

Type String Required False Default From ConfigData.json

docs.title: -TenantId
docs.text:
Azure AD tenant ID.

Type String Required False Default From ConfigData.json

docs.title: -ClientId
docs.text:
Azure AD application (client) ID.

Type String Required False Default From ConfigData.json

docs.title: -ClientSecret
docs.text:
Client secret for authentication.

Type String Required False Default From ConfigData.json

docs.title: -Scope
docs.text:
OAuth2 scope.

Type String Required False Default From ConfigData.json

docs.title: -CertificateThumbprint
docs.text:
Certificate thumbprint for certificate-based authentication.

Type String Required True (CertificateThumbprint set)

docs.title: -CertificatePath
docs.text:
Path to PFX certificate file.

Type String Required True (CertificatePfx set)

docs.title: -CertificatePassword
docs.text:
Password for PFX file.

Type SecureString Required False

docs.title: Example 1: Connect using ConfigData.json
docs.text:
Connect-NMMApi

Connects using credentials stored in ConfigData.json.

docs.title: Example 2: Connect with explicit credentials
docs.text: Connect-NMMApi -ClientId "your-id" -ClientSecret "your-secret" -TenantId "your-tenant"

docs.title: Example 3: Connect with certificate thumbprint
docs.text: Connect-NMMApi -CertificateThumbprint "ABC123DEF456789"

docs.title: Example 4: Connect with PFX file
docs.text:
$password = ConvertTo-SecureString "pfx-password" -AsPlainText -Force
Connect-NMMApi -CertificatePath "./cert.pfx" -CertificatePassword $password

docs.title: Outputs
docs.text:
PSCustomObject

Property Type Description Expiry DateTime Token expiration time TokenType String Always "Bearer" APIUrl String API base URL AccessToken String The access token AuthMethod String "Secret" or "Certificate"

docs.title: Notes
docs.text:
• The token is cached in memory and reused for subsequent cmdlet calls
  • Token expires after ~1 hour; re-run Connect-NMMApi to refresh
  • Certificate auth is recommended for production environments

docs.title: Related Links
docs.text:
• Get-NMMApiToken
  • New-NMMApiCertificate
  • Configuration Guide

docs.title: Get-NMMApiToken
docs.text: Gets the current cached API access token.

docs.title: Syntax
docs.text: Get-NMMApiToken [<CommonParameters>]

docs.title: Description
docs.text: The Get-NMMApiToken cmdlet returns the currently cached access token from a previous Connect-NMMApi call. This is useful for checking authentication status and token expiration.

docs.title: Example 1: Get current token
docs.text:
Get-NMMApiToken

Expiry      : 12/9/2025 8:30:00 PM
TokenType   : Bearer
APIUrl      : https://contoso.nerdio.net/rest-api/v1
AccessToken : eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLC...
AuthMethod  : Certificate

docs.title: Example 2: Check if token is expired
docs.text:
$token = Get-NMMApiToken
if ($token.Expiry -lt (Get-Date)) {
    Write-Host "Token expired, reconnecting..."
    Connect-NMMApi
}

docs.title: Outputs
docs.text:
PSCustomObject or $null if not authenticated.

Property Type Description Expiry DateTime Token expiration time TokenType String Always "Bearer" APIUrl String API base URL AccessToken String The access token AuthMethod String Authentication method used

docs.title: Notes
docs.text:
• Returns $null if Connect-NMMApi hasn't been called
  • The token is stored in module scope and persists for the PowerShell session

docs.title: Related Links
docs.text: • Connect-NMMApi

docs.title: New-NMMApiCertificate
docs.text: Creates a self-signed certificate for NMM API authentication.

docs.title: Syntax
docs.text:
New-NMMApiCertificate
    [-CertificateName <String>]
    [-ValidityMonths <Int32>]
    [-ExportToPfx <String>]
    [-PfxPassword <SecureString>]
    [-ExportToPem <String>]
    [-ExportToCertStore]
    [-StoreLocation <String>]
    [-ExportToKeyVault]
    [-VaultName <String>]
    [-Upload]
    [-UploadMethod <String>]
    [-ApplicationId <String>]
    [-TenantId <String>]
    [-UpdateConfig]
    [<CommonParameters>]

docs.title: Description
docs.text: The New-NMMApiCertificate cmdlet creates a self-signed certificate for certificate-based authentication with Azure AD. It supports multiple export destinations and can automatically upload the public key to your app registration.

docs.title: -CertificateName
docs.text:
Display name for the certificate.

Type String Required False Default "NMM-API-Certificate"

docs.title: -ValidityMonths
docs.text:
Certificate validity period in months.

Type Int32 Required False Default 12

docs.title: -ExportToPfx
docs.text:
Path to export PFX file.

Type String Required False

docs.title: -ExportToCertStore
docs.text:
Export to Windows Certificate Store or macOS Keychain.

Type Switch Required False

docs.title: -Upload
docs.text:
Upload public certificate to Azure AD app registration.

Type Switch Required False

docs.title: -UploadMethod
docs.text:
Authentication method for upload: DeviceCode, Interactive, or Secret.

Type String Required False Default DeviceCode

docs.title: -UpdateConfig
docs.text:
Update ConfigData.json with certificate details.

Type Switch Required False

docs.title: Example 1: Create and store in certificate store
docs.text:
New-NMMApiCertificate -ExportToCertStore -UpdateConfig

Creates a certificate, imports to local cert store, and updates config.

docs.title: Example 2: Full setup with Azure AD upload
docs.text:
New-NMMApiCertificate -ExportToPfx "./nmm-cert.pfx" `
                      -ExportToCertStore `
                      -Upload `
                      -UploadMethod DeviceCode `
                      -UpdateConfig

Creates certificate, exports to PFX, imports to store, uploads to Azure AD, and updates config.

docs.title: Example 3: Export to Key Vault
docs.text: New-NMMApiCertificate -ExportToKeyVault -VaultName "my-keyvault" -UpdateConfig

docs.title: Outputs
docs.text:
PSCustomObject

Property Type Description Thumbprint String Certificate thumbprint Subject String Certificate subject (CN=...) NotBefore DateTime Validity start date NotAfter DateTime Expiration date ExportedTo String[] Export locations UploadedToAzureAD Boolean Upload success status

docs.title: Notes
docs.text:
• Requires appropriate permissions to upload to Azure AD (Application.ReadWrite.All or Application.ReadWrite.OwnedBy)
  • Device code flow requires user interaction in a browser
  • The generated password for PFX is displayed once; save it securely

docs.title: Related Links
docs.text:
• Connect-NMMApi
  • Authentication Guide

docs.title: Scope Parameter
docs.text:
Most automation cmdlets support the -Scope parameter:

  • Account: Resources scoped to a specific account
  • Global: Resources available across all accounts

docs.title: Sync-NMMDevice
docs.text: Forces an Intune sync for a device.

docs.title: Syntax
docs.text:
Sync-NMMDevice
    -AccountId <Int32>
    -DeviceId <String>
    [<CommonParameters>]

docs.title: Description
docs.text:
The Sync-NMMDevice cmdlet triggers an immediate Intune policy sync for a device.

Beta API

This cmdlet uses the v1-beta API.

docs.title: -AccountId
docs.text:
The NMM account ID.

Type Int32 Required True Pipeline Input True (ByPropertyName)

docs.title: -DeviceId
docs.text:
The Intune device ID.

Type String Required True Pipeline Input True (ByPropertyName)

docs.title: Example 1: Sync a device
docs.text: Sync-NMMDevice -AccountId 123 -DeviceId "device-abc-123"

docs.title: Example 2: Sync all non-compliant devices
docs.text:
Get-NMMDevice -AccountId 123 |
    Where-Object { $_.complianceState -eq 'NonCompliant' } |
    ForEach-Object { Sync-NMMDevice -AccountId 123 -DeviceId $_.deviceId }

docs.title: Outputs
docs.text:
PSCustomObject

Property Type Description success Boolean Sync initiated message String Status message

docs.title: Notes
docs.text:
• Sync is asynchronous; use Get-NMMDevice to check updated status
  • Rate limits may apply for bulk sync operations

docs.title: New-NMMHostPool
docs.text: Creates a new Azure Virtual Desktop host pool.

docs.title: Syntax
docs.text:
New-NMMHostPool
    -AccountId <Int32>
    -Name <String>
    -ResourceGroup <String>
    -HostPoolType <String>
    [-Description <String>]
    [-MaxSessionLimit <Int32>]
    [-LoadBalancerType <String>]
    [<CommonParameters>]

docs.title: Description
docs.text: The New-NMMHostPool cmdlet creates a new Azure Virtual Desktop host pool within an NMM account.

docs.title: -AccountId
docs.text:
The NMM account ID.

Type Int32 Required True

docs.title: -Name
docs.text:
The name for the new host pool.

Type String Required True

docs.title: -ResourceGroup
docs.text:
The Azure resource group for the host pool.

Type String Required True

docs.title: -HostPoolType
docs.text:
The type of host pool.

Type String Required True Valid Values Pooled, Personal

docs.title: -Description
docs.text:
Optional description for the host pool.

Type String Required False

docs.title: -MaxSessionLimit
docs.text:
Maximum sessions per host (for pooled pools).

Type Int32 Required False Default 10

docs.title: -LoadBalancerType
docs.text:
Load balancing algorithm.

Type String Required False Default BreadthFirst Valid Values BreadthFirst, DepthFirst

docs.title: Example 1: Create a pooled host pool
docs.text: New-NMMHostPool -AccountId 123 -Name "hp-production" -ResourceGroup "rg-avd" -HostPoolType "Pooled"

docs.title: Example 2: Create with custom settings
docs.text:
New-NMMHostPool -AccountId 123 -Name "hp-dev" -ResourceGroup "rg-avd" `
    -HostPoolType "Pooled" -MaxSessionLimit 5 -LoadBalancerType "DepthFirst"

docs.title: Outputs
docs.text:
PSCustomObject

Returns the created host pool object.

docs.title: Remove-NMMHostPool
docs.text: Removes an Azure Virtual Desktop host pool.

docs.title: Syntax
docs.text:
Remove-NMMHostPool
    -AccountId <Int32>
    -SubscriptionId <String>
    -ResourceGroup <String>
    -PoolName <String>
    [-Force]
    [<CommonParameters>]

docs.title: Description
docs.text: The Remove-NMMHostPool cmdlet deletes an Azure Virtual Desktop host pool and optionally its associated resources.

docs.title: -AccountId
docs.text:
The NMM account ID.

Type Int32 Required True Pipeline Input True (ByPropertyName)

docs.title: -SubscriptionId
docs.text:
The Azure subscription ID.

Type String Required True Pipeline Input True (ByPropertyName)

docs.title: -ResourceGroup
docs.text:
The Azure resource group name.

Type String Required True Pipeline Input True (ByPropertyName)

docs.title: -PoolName
docs.text:
The host pool name to remove.

Type String Required True Pipeline Input True (ByPropertyName)

docs.title: -Force
docs.text:
Skip confirmation prompt.

Type Switch Required False

docs.title: Example 1: Remove a host pool
docs.text: Remove-NMMHostPool -AccountId 123 -SubscriptionId "sub-id" -ResourceGroup "rg-avd" -PoolName "hp-dev"

docs.title: Example 2: Remove without confirmation
docs.text: Remove-NMMHostPool -AccountId 123 -SubscriptionId "sub-id" -ResourceGroup "rg-avd" -PoolName "hp-dev" -Force

docs.title: Notes
docs.text:
• This is a destructive operation
  • Ensure all sessions are terminated before removal
  • Associated VMs may need to be removed separately

docs.title: Examples
docs.text: Real-world examples and automation scenarios for NMM-PS.

docs.title: Get All Host Pools Across All Accounts
docs.text:
# Connect first
Connect-NMMApi

# Get all host pools for all accounts
Get-NMMAccount | Get-NMMHostPool | Format-Table -Property poolName, hostPoolType, resourceGroup

docs.title: Export Active Sessions Report
docs.text:
# Get all active sessions across all accounts
$sessions = Get-NMMAccount | ForEach-Object {
    $account = $_
    Get-NMMHostPool -AccountId $_.id | ForEach-Object {
        Get-NMMHostPoolSession -AccountId $account.id `
            -SubscriptionId $_.subscriptionId `
            -ResourceGroup $_.resourceGroup `
            -PoolName $_.poolName |
        Select-Object @{N='Account';E={$account.name}}, *
    }
}

# Export to CSV
$sessions | Export-Csv -Path "sessions-report.csv" -NoTypeInformation

docs.title: Check Host Pool Health
docs.text:
function Get-HostPoolHealth {
    param([int]$AccountId)

    Get-NMMHostPool -AccountId $AccountId | ForEach-Object {
        $pool = $_
        $hosts = Get-NMMHost -AccountId $AccountId `
            -SubscriptionId $_.subscriptionId `
            -ResourceGroup $_.resourceGroup `
            -PoolName $_.poolName

        [PSCustomObject]@{
            PoolName = $pool.poolName
            TotalHosts = $hosts.Count
            AvailableHosts = ($hosts | Where-Object status -eq 'Available').Count
            UnavailableHosts = ($hosts | Where-Object status -eq 'Unavailable').Count
            TotalSessions = ($hosts | Measure-Object -Property sessionCount -Sum).Sum
        }
    }
}

Get-HostPoolHealth -AccountId 123

docs.title: Sync Non-Compliant Devices
docs.text:
# Find and sync all non-compliant devices
Get-NMMAccount | ForEach-Object {
    $accountId = $_.id
    Get-NMMDevice -AccountId $accountId |
        Where-Object { $_.complianceState -ne 'Compliant' } |
        ForEach-Object {
            Write-Host "Syncing device: $($_.deviceName)"
            Sync-NMMDevice -AccountId $accountId -DeviceId $_.deviceId
        }
}

docs.title: Certificate-Based Authentication
docs.text:
# Create and configure certificate
New-NMMApiCertificate -ExportToCertStore -Upload -UpdateConfig

# Connect using certificate
Connect-NMMApi -CertificateThumbprint "YOUR_THUMBPRINT"

docs.title: Token Expiry Check
docs.text:
function Test-NMMConnection {
    $token = Get-NMMApiToken
    if ($null -eq $token) {
        Write-Host "Not connected. Connecting..."
        Connect-NMMApi
    }
    elseif ($token.Expiry -lt (Get-Date)) {
        Write-Host "Token expired. Reconnecting..."
        Connect-NMMApi
    }
    else {
        Write-Host "Connected. Token valid until $($token.Expiry)"
    }
}

docs.title: Scheduled Autoscale Update
docs.text:
# Update autoscale settings for all production pools
Get-NMMAccount | Get-NMMHostPool |
    Where-Object { $_.poolName -like "*prod*" } |
    ForEach-Object {
        Set-NMMAutoscale -AccountId $_.accountId `
            -SubscriptionId $_.subscriptionId `
            -ResourceGroup $_.resourceGroup `
            -PoolName $_.poolName `
            -MinActiveHosts 2 `
            -MaxActiveHosts 20
    }

docs.title: Backup Status Report
docs.text:
# Generate backup health report
$report = Get-NMMAccount | ForEach-Object {
    $account = $_
    Get-NMMProtectedItem -AccountId $_.id |
    Select-Object @{N='Account';E={$account.name}},
        friendlyName,
        protectionStatus,
        lastBackupStatus,
        lastBackupTime
}

$report | Where-Object lastBackupStatus -ne 'Completed' |
    Format-Table -AutoSize

docs.title: User Session Audit
docs.text:
# Find users with multiple active sessions
$allSessions = Get-NMMAccount | Get-NMMHostPool | ForEach-Object {
    Get-NMMHostPoolSession -AccountId $_.accountId `
        -SubscriptionId $_.subscriptionId `
        -ResourceGroup $_.resourceGroup `
        -PoolName $_.poolName
}

$allSessions |
    Group-Object userName |
    Where-Object { $_.Count -gt 1 } |
    Select-Object Name, Count |
    Sort-Object Count -Descending

docs.title: Chaining Commands
docs.text:
# Full pipeline: Account → Host Pool → Sessions
Get-NMMAccount -Name "Contoso*" |
    Get-NMMHostPool |
    Where-Object { $_.hostPoolType -eq 'Pooled' } |
    Get-NMMHostPoolSession |
    Format-Table userName, sessionHost, sessionState

docs.title: Filtering with Where-Object
docs.text:
# Find pools with high session counts
Get-NMMAccount | Get-NMMHostPool | ForEach-Object {
    $sessions = Get-NMMHostPoolSession -AccountId $_.accountId `
        -SubscriptionId $_.subscriptionId `
        -ResourceGroup $_.resourceGroup `
        -PoolName $_.poolName

    [PSCustomObject]@{
        Pool = $_.poolName
        Sessions = $sessions.Count
    }
} | Where-Object Sessions -gt 10

docs.title: Robust API Calls
docs.text:
function Invoke-SafeNMMCommand {
    param(
        [scriptblock]$Command,
        [int]$MaxRetries = 3
    )

    $attempt = 0
    while ($attempt -lt $MaxRetries) {
        try {
            return & $Command
        }
        catch {
            $attempt++
            if ($attempt -eq $MaxRetries) {
                throw $_
            }
            Write-Warning "Attempt $attempt failed. Retrying..."
            Start-Sleep -Seconds (2 * $attempt)
        }
    }
}

# Usage
Invoke-SafeNMMCommand { Get-NMMHostPool -AccountId 123 }

docs.title: Getting Started
docs.text: Welcome to NMM-PS! This guide will help you get up and running quickly.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
NMM-PS is a PowerShell module that provides cmdlets for automating Nerdio Manager for MSP (NMM) operations. With NMM-PS, you can:

  • Manage accounts and workspaces
  • Configure host pools and session hosts
  • Manage desktop images and templates
  • Monitor user sessions
  • Automate backup operations
  • Control Intune-managed devices

docs.title: Quick Start
docs.text:
1. Install the module 

    Install-Module -Name NMM-PS

  2. Configure credentials in ConfigData.json

  3. Connect to the API 

    Import-Module NMM-PS
Connect-NMMApi

  4. Start automating! 

    Get-NMMAccount | Get-NMMHostPool

docs.title: Next Steps
docs.text:
• Installation

    Install NMM-PS on your system

  • Configuration

    Set up your API credentials

  • Authentication

    Learn about authentication methods

docs.title: Authentication
docs.text: NMM-PS supports multiple authentication methods to connect to the NMM API.

docs.title: Authentication Methods
docs.text: Method Security Use Case Client Secret Standard Development, simple automation Certificate High Production, CI/CD pipelines

docs.title: Client Secret Authentication
docs.text:
The simplest method uses a client secret stored in ConfigData.json:

{
    "BaseUri": "https://your-instance.nerdio.net",
    "TenantId": "your-tenant-id",
    "ClientId": "your-client-id",
    "Scope": "api://your-app-id/.default",
    "ClientSecret": "your-client-secret"
}

Connect using:

Connect-NMMApi

Or pass credentials directly:

Connect-NMMApi -ClientId "your-id" -ClientSecret "your-secret" -TenantId "your-tenant"

docs.title: Certificate Authentication
docs.text: Certificate authentication is more secure and recommended for production use.

docs.title: Step 1: Create a Certificate
docs.text:
Use New-NMMApiCertificate to generate a self-signed certificate:

# Create certificate and upload to Azure AD
New-NMMApiCertificate -ExportToPfx "./nmm-cert.pfx" `
                      -ExportToCertStore `
                      -Upload `
                      -UploadMethod DeviceCode `
                      -UpdateConfig

This will:

  1. Generate a self-signed certificate
  2. Export to a PFX file (backup)
  3. Import to Windows Certificate Store or macOS Keychain
  4. Upload public key to your Azure AD app registration
  5. Update ConfigData.json with certificate details

docs.title: Step 2: Configure for Certificate Auth
docs.text:
After running New-NMMApiCertificate -UpdateConfig, your config will be updated:

{
    "BaseUri": "https://your-instance.nerdio.net",
    "TenantId": "your-tenant-id",
    "ClientId": "your-client-id",
    "Scope": "api://your-app-id/.default",
    "AuthMethod": "Certificate",
    "Certificate": {
        "Source": "PfxFile",
        "Path": "./nmm-cert.pfx",
        "Thumbprint": "ABC123DEF456..."
    }
}

docs.title: Certificate Storage Options
Connect with Certificate
docs.text:
Once configured, simply run:

Connect-NMMApi

Or specify the certificate directly:

# By thumbprint (Windows/macOS)
Connect-NMMApi -CertificateThumbprint "ABC123DEF456..."

# By PFX file
$password = ConvertTo-SecureString "password" -AsPlainText -Force
Connect-NMMApi -CertificatePath "./cert.pfx" -CertificatePassword $password

docs.title: Token Caching
docs.text:
After successful authentication, the token is cached in memory:

# First call authenticates
Connect-NMMApi

# Subsequent calls use cached token (until expiry)
Connect-NMMApi  # Returns cached token

To force re-authentication, restart your PowerShell session.

docs.title: View Current Token
docs.text:
Check your current authentication status:

$token = Get-NMMApiToken
$token

# Output:
# Expiry      : 12/9/2025 8:30:00 PM
# TokenType   : Bearer
# APIUrl      : https://your-instance.nerdio.net/rest-api/v1
# AuthMethod  : Certificate

docs.title: "Not authenticated" Error
docs.text:
Run Connect-NMMApi before calling other cmdlets:

Connect-NMMApi
Get-NMMAccount  # Now works

docs.title: "Token expired" Error
docs.text:
The token has expired. Re-run Connect-NMMApi:

Connect-NMMApi

docs.title: Certificate Not Found
docs.text:
Ensure the certificate is installed in the correct store:

# Windows - Check certificate store
Get-ChildItem Cert:\CurrentUser\My | Where-Object Thumbprint -eq "ABC123..."

# macOS - Check keychain
security find-certificate -a -c "NMM-API"

docs.title: Invalid Client Secret
docs.text: Verify your ConfigData.json has the correct secret and that it hasn't expired in Azure AD.

docs.title: Configuration
docs.text: NMM-PS uses a JSON configuration file to store API credentials and settings.

docs.title: Configuration File Location
docs.text:
The configuration file is located at:

<module-path>/Private/Data/ConfigData.json

For local development, set the environment variable NMM_DEV_MODE=true to use ConfigData-Local.json instead.

docs.title: Configuration Structure
docs.text:
Create or edit ConfigData.json with your NMM API credentials:

{
    "BaseUri": "https://your-nerdio-instance.nerdio.net",
    "TenantId": "your-azure-tenant-id",
    "ClientId": "your-app-registration-client-id",
    "Scope": "api://your-app-id/.default",
    "ClientSecret": "your-client-secret"
}

docs.title: Required Fields
docs.text: Field Description Example BaseUri Your NMM instance URL https://contoso.nerdio.net TenantId Azure AD tenant ID d26d1e01-5e94-4110-848b-ecba9ee44f60 ClientId App registration client ID 7ee590b9-bea3-4d65-b6da-2cfa33ff8faa Scope OAuth2 scope api://31d1c288-f4d8-46b9-88bd-aab9abac37d5/.default ClientSecret Client secret (or use certificate) 90.8Q~...

docs.title: Certificate Authentication
docs.text:
For enhanced security, you can use certificate-based authentication instead of a client secret:

{
    "BaseUri": "https://your-nerdio-instance.nerdio.net",
    "TenantId": "your-azure-tenant-id",
    "ClientId": "your-app-registration-client-id",
    "Scope": "api://your-app-id/.default",
    "AuthMethod": "Certificate",
    "Certificate": {
        "Source": "CertStore",
        "Thumbprint": "ABC123DEF456...",
        "StoreLocation": "CurrentUser",
        "StoreName": "My"
    }
}

See Authentication for more details on certificate setup.

docs.title: Environment Variables
docs.text:
For CI/CD pipelines or containerized environments, you can override configuration with environment variables:

export NMM_BASE_URI="https://contoso.nerdio.net"
export NMM_TENANT_ID="your-tenant-id"
export NMM_CLIENT_ID="your-client-id"
export NMM_CLIENT_SECRET="your-secret"

docs.title: Development Mode
docs.text:
For local development, create a ConfigData-Local.json file and enable dev mode:

$env:NMM_DEV_MODE = 'true'
Import-Module ./NMM-PS.psm1

This keeps production credentials separate from development credentials.

docs.title: Validate Configuration
docs.text:
Test your configuration by connecting to the API:

Import-Module NMM-PS
Connect-NMMApi -Verbose

A successful connection returns a token object:

VERBOSE: Using secret authentication
VERBOSE: Successfully authenticated with client secret

docs.title: Next Steps
docs.text: Learn about the different authentication methods available.

docs.title: Requirements
docs.text:
• PowerShell 7.0+ (PowerShell Core)
  • Windows, macOS, or Linux

PowerShell Version

NMM-PS requires PowerShell 7.0 or higher. Windows PowerShell 5.1 is not supported.

docs.title: Install from PowerShell Gallery
docs.text:
The recommended way to install NMM-PS is from the PowerShell Gallery:

Install-Module -Name NMM-PS -Scope CurrentUser

To install for all users (requires admin/sudo):

Install-Module -Name NMM-PS -Scope AllUsers

docs.title: Install from GitHub
docs.text:
Clone the repository and import directly:

# Clone the repository
git clone https://github.com/Get-Nerdio/NMM-PS.git

# Import the module
Import-Module ./NMM-PS/NMM-PS.psm1

docs.title: Update the Module
docs.text:
To update to the latest version:

Update-Module -Name NMM-PS

docs.title: Verify Installation
docs.text:
Check that the module is installed correctly:

# List module information
Get-Module -Name NMM-PS -ListAvailable

# Import and check available commands
Import-Module NMM-PS
Get-Command -Module NMM-PS

You should see 60+ cmdlets available.

docs.title: Uninstall
docs.text:
To remove NMM-PS:

Uninstall-Module -Name NMM-PS

docs.title: Next Steps
docs.text: After installation, configure your API credentials.
